intro: Palicourea longipedunculata, commonly known as the long peduncle palicourea, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to Central and South America, where it typically grows in humid tropical forests. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite, ovate leaves with a glossy surface. Its small, fragrant flowers are usually white or pale yellow and are clustered in elongated inflorescences. It is sometimes used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
